links.label: Waking
links.transitionText: If you would like to take the waking survey, please tap the next button.  If not, please tap the go back button.

links.label: Bedtime
links.transitionText: If you would like to take the bedtime survey, please tap the next button.  If not, please tap the go back button.

links.label: Beeped
links.transitionText: If you would like to take the beeped survey, please tap the next button.  If not, please tap the go back button.

screens.mainText: The following questions ask about how you feel RIGHT NOW.
On the following screens are descriptions of specific feelings you might be experiencing. Please rate how well each describes what you feel RIGHT NOW.
How HAPPY do you feel right now?
How TENSE/ANXIOUS do you feel right now?
How much ENJOYMENT/FUN do you feel right now?
How DEPRESSED/BLUE do you feel right now?
The next questions ask about significant events that happened since the last assessment.
Did anything stressful occur since the last assessment? A stressful event is any event, even a minor one, which negatively affected you.
How would you describe this stressful event?  If more than one event happened, please pick the most significant event.
How unpleasant was this ARGUMENT/CONFLICT/DISAGREEMENT for you?
How much have you thought about this ARGUMENT/CONFLICT/DISAGREEMENT since it happened?
How unpleasant was this FINANCIAL EVENT for you?
How much have you thought about this FINANCIAL EVENT since it happened?
How unpleasant was this HOME-RELATED EVENT for you?
How much have you thought about this HOME-RELATED EVENT since it happened?
How unpleasant was this WORK-RELATED EVENT for you?
How much have you thought about this WORK-RELATED EVENT since it happened?
How unpleasant was this HEALTH EVENT OR ACCIDENT for you?
How much have you thought about this HEALTH EVENT OR ACCIDENT since it happened?
How unpleasant was this EVENT THAT HAPPENED TO OTHERS for you?
How much have you thought about this EVENT THAT HAPPENED TO OTHERS since it happened?
How unpleasant was this OTHER EVENT for you?
How much have you thought about this OTHER EVENT since it happened?

inputs.label: Stressful things don't usually happen to me
I handled situations before they became stressful

screens.mainText: Why do you think nothing stressful happened to you since the last assessment?

In the past 5 minutes...
What were you MOSTLY doing?
Where are you <u>right now</u>?
Now get ready to play a few brain games!
Which of these best describes how you feel <u>right now</u>?

Since the last assessment...
Have difficulties been piling up?
How UNHAPPY do you feel right now?

In the past 5 minutes...
Were you thinking about personal problems or worries?
Do you think anything stressful or unpleasant will happen in the next few hours?
The following questions ask about your activities during the past 5 minutes.
How FRUSTRATED do you feel right now?
How unpleasant was this TRAFFIC OR TRANSPORTATION EVENT for you?
How much have you thought about this TRAFFIC OR TRANSPORTATION EVENT since it happened?
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were doing chores during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were doing work-related activities during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were socializing during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were eating/drinking during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were being physically active during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were involved in recreation during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were doing self-care during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were resting during the past 5 minutes.
The next questions ask about what was on your mind while you were doing something else during the past 5 minutes.

Since the last assessment...
Have you been able to control important things?

Were you dealing with a problem?
How stressful was this problem?

In the past 5 minutes...
Were you juggling several tasks at once?
Did anything uplifting occur since the last assessment? An uplifting event is any event, even a minor one, which affected you in a positive way.
How much did you enjoy this uplifting event?  If more than one event happened, please consider the most significant event.
How much have you thought about this uplifting event since it happened?

On the next screens are questions about how you slept last night.
When did you go to bed last night (that is, get into bed with the intention of sleeping)?
When did you get up this morning?
How many hours of actual sleep did you get last night? (this may be different than the number of hours you spend in bed)
How would you rate your sleep quality last night?
Was your sleep refreshing?
Did you have trouble staying asleep?
Did you have difficulty falling asleep?
Overall, how PLEASANT do you expect today will be?
Overall, how STRESSFUL do you expect today will be?
You have completed your Wake-up survey! Please carry the smart phone with you today and complete the surveys when you are beeped. Thank you for completing the survey!
On the next screens are questions about how you expect your day will be.
On the following screens are descriptions of feelings. Considering the entire day since you woke up, please rate how you felt today.
How TENSE/ANXIOUS did you feel today?
Did you have a hard time getting things done because you were fatigued today?
The next several screens ask questions about your health and physical symptoms TODAY.
Which symptoms did you experience today?
How much did these symptoms interfere with or restrict your daily activities today?
Overall, how have you felt physically today?
Today, was your mind as sharp as usual?
Today, was your memory as good as usual?
On the next several screens are statements that describe different thoughts that people sometimes have. For each one, choose the response that best describes the thoughts you had TODAY.
Today, how often did you experience a train of thought that was difficult to get out of your head?
You have completed the bedtime survey! Please make sure to connect your smartphone to an outlet so it will be fully charged for tomorrow. Thank you and good night!
How HAPPY did you feel today?
Today, how often did you think about personal problems and worries?
The next several pages will ask questions about your mental focus, memory, and attention during the day TODAY.
Today, was your thinking as fast as usual?
Today, how often were you preoccupied with thoughts about the future?
During the day today did you forget any of the following?
Did you forget any of these other things today?
Did forgetting this bother you?
Did forgetting this interfere with your daily routine?
Did forgetting this bother you?
Did forgetting this interfere with your daily routine?
Did you use any of the following to help you remember? (Check all that apply)
How likely are you to forget these things tomorrow?
Today, did difficulties seem to be piling up?
Today, were you able to control important things?
How FRUSTRATED did you feel today?
Today, how often did you think about situations that upset you?
Today, did you feel like things were going your way?
Overall, how pleasant were your social interactions today?
The next questions are about what you expect your day will be like tomorrow.
Overall, how PLEASANT do you expect tomorrow will be?
Overall, how STRESSFUL do you expect tomorrow will be?
